showScoreExcerpt: "It was phenomenal off-Broadway. It's even better now. 'Hamilton' is that rare musical that fires on all cylinders, even ones we never knew existed...In a sense, the collective talents of this bravura company pay homage to Broadway's founding fathers - and mothers - by pushing the envelope on an artform that at best, teaches us, enlightens us and entertains us like nothing else."

keyPhrases.quote: It was phenomenal off-Broadway. It's even better now.
Hamilton is that rare musical that fires on all cylinders, even ones we never knew existed
bravura company pay homage to Broadway's founding fathers - and mothers - by pushing the envelope on an artform

llmScore.reasoning: Claude: Unqualified superlatives throughout ('phenomenal', 'even better', 'rare musical', 'bravura company') with language indicating the show transcends expectations and pushes artistic boundaries. | GPT-4o-mini: The review expresses unqualified enthusiasm and highlights the show's exceptional qualities, indicating a strong recommendation.
